newsitem.title: EGYPT: Arab League to meet over Israel tunnel row.
newsitem.headline: Arab League to meet over Israel tunnel row.

text.p: The Arab League will meet in Cairo on Thursday at the request of the Palestinians to discuss Israel's decision to reopen a tunnel in Jerusalem close to the Aqsa mosque, Islam's third holiest site.
The one-day extraordinary session will be at the level of permanent representatives -- the ambassadors of the 22 member states -- said a spokesman for the league on Wednesday.
The tunnel has angered Palestinians and other Arabs, who believe Israel is trying to turn Jerusalem into a wholly Jewish city and obliterate sites of importance to Moslems.
Israel says the tunnel, which runs under the Western Wall of the Temple Mount, is meant to give tourists easier access to archaeological sites under the wall.
Outside Jerusalem on Wednesday Israeli troops wounded 130 Palestinians, five seriously, when they dispersed people throwing stones in protests related to the tunnel.
